<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/f877983c4f5dc185bb3b4a0e8611b711/tumblr_inline_ncbsnp6OOM1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><a href="http://bit.ly/1r1RuQM"><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/b57f693d7aec3986357a8d5c5888c131/tumblr_inline_ncbste20HM1rr2wit.png"/></a></p>

<p><strong>Youen’s</strong> <a href="http://bit.ly/1r1RuQM"><strong>(ATMOSPHERIC) TRAJECTORIES</strong></a> displays trajectory predictions in a number of ways. As seen in the picture above, you have the stock trajectory, the mod trajectory (if you use, say, NEAR or FAR) and impact location. Lift and drag, among others, are all accounted for. It even can help with aerobraking maneuvers, space plane descent profiles and reaching a specific points on any celestial body.</p>

<p>For more info and download links for <strong>(Atmospheric) Trajectories</strong>, click <a href="http://bit.ly/1r1RuQM"><strong>HERE</strong></a>.</p>

<p></p>

OH MY DEITY, gimmegimmegimme!

If this is what I think it is... no more over/undershooting the KSC for me!

EDIT:

Well, bit of a fun-killer, but my Interwebs (or maybe the Forum ) keeps crashing on me.

I'll get this mod eventually though, because I really suck at pinpoint KSC landings without wings.

Edited September 23, 2014 by Starwhip
So, since it's featured by SQUAD, it's gonna be implemented into stock, right?
Landing at KSC was the entire reason i got Mechjeb... But this... FINALLY!!!!
I said it in the thread and I'll say it here: This should be stock (like so many mods I use) and I'm so glad there's now a mod for it.
Oh hey! It's updated for NEAR! Trying this now!
This is what I need! Let the max recovery values begin11111

landing prediction with FAR?

I`ll have to have a look...

I wanted this mod forever, but in its absence, I got really good at pinpoint landings using alterbarons atmospheric re-entry charts.

See how old fashioned folk used to so it: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/37327-Atmospheric-Landing-Charts-Pinpoint-landings%21-NEW-UPDATE-No-Protractor-Required%21

Been great swing this mod develop so quickly.

Who needs spaceplanes when your fuel drones can land on the runway?

Control surfaces? Bah! Extra Weight!

http://www.twitch.tv/dasvaldez/c/5170719

Freaking. Awesome. Mod. A++++ Great Modder would install again.

How do you predict a landing with FAR/NEAR? Turn the craft the wrong way and the prediction suddenly changes. I'll have to give this a try, either it is an incredibly well thought out and developed plugin that takes craft shape into account or it doesn't work well with FAR/NEAR.

How do you predict a landing with FAR/NEAR? Turn the craft the wrong way and the prediction suddenly changes. I'll have to give this a try, either it is an incredibly well thought out and developed plugin that takes craft shape into account or it doesn't work well with FAR/NEAR.

It was done using the highly scientific field of Magic......

It was done using the highly scientific field of Magic......

Lol. I'm really curious how he did it though.
Holy guacamole! This definitely goes into my install right away! I wanted a feature like that for a long time.

Lol. I'm really curious how he did it though.

From whats been said he passes your crafts data to the FAR dll with fake altitude etc the intercepts and uses the responses to project a possible path (assuming constant attitude etc)

From whats been said he passes your crafts data to the FAR dll with fake altitude etc the intercepts and uses the responses to project a possible path (assuming constant attitude etc)

That's not what I'm hearing from the conversation in the release thread. Basically it just assumes your pointing at the velocity vector, so if you are aerobraking behind a heat shield it won't work. If your landing a pod, it probably wouldn't have calculated parachutes anyway... but it won't work, it should work ok for planes or non-atmospheric landings.

EDIT: But the author says he's working on the aerobrake thing, which is good news.

Edited September 23, 2014 by Alshain
Righty-oh, my computer stopped hating and let me download. I'm going to try it out later.
Um, I'm not sure where to report this, but I'm getting a 500 Internal Server error on the KSP website... Is this normal while you update the site?

Um, I'm not sure where to report this, but I'm getting a 500 Internal Server error on the KSP website... Is this normal while you update the site?

Don't worry! That's just the magical shock wave of the HypeVehicle!

(If too many people log on and overload the site then you get that)

This is an excellent, easy-to-use mod I am now playing with myself!

In my opinion, it should be made part of the stock game.

Regards,

Northstar

Not finding it accurate at all, at least with FAR. Doesn't seem to take into account lift and angle for capsules. Tried a Soyuz reentry and the prediction from orbit was off by 1/4 the circumference of Kerbin.
